des:
With the Wiser for KNX Skill by Schneider Electric, you can now control your KNX devices by voice commands or through the Alexa app. Once you have your Touch visualization set in your Wiser for KNX controller, follow the steps below to link it to your Alexa account and you will be able to control your selected Widgets.

Current supported Widgets: Light switch, General switch, AC switch, Fan switch, Socket switch, Dimmers (horizontal, vertical and rotary), Shutter (horizontal, vertical and rotary) and Scenes.

Requirements & Preconditions:
- A Wiser for KNX logic controller (with the Touch visu updated to its latest version available in the marketplace)
- Your KNX visualization created in the Touch visu. 
- Wiser for KNX remote app account (if not available, download the Wiser for KNX app from the Appstore or Google Play and register)
 
Configuration:
1. Access the marketplace in your Wiser for KNX controller and download the following apps: 
 a. “Cloud Connector” – Open the app and enable it 
 b. “IoT T3 API” – Open the app and enable it
 c. Touch visu (update in case there is a newer version available)
2. In your Touch Config (admin), make sure the widgets that you want to control by voice have the “Voice Control” checkbox enabled.
 Note: The Name given to the Widgets will be the one used in Alexa. We recommend using simple names
3. Enable the Wiser for KNX Skill in the Alexa App, and log in with the same credentials of your Wiser for KNX Remote app 
4. Once the accounts are linked together, trigger the discovery process by saying “Alexa, discover my devices” or in the Alexa App.

If you need a more detailed step by step guide or if you have any questions, please read the “Voice Control Integration” document, available in the download section in https://www.se.com/ww/en/product/LSS100100/wiser-for-knx-logic-controller/

Examples of the Voice Commands currently supported:
"Alexa, turn ceiling light on"
"Alexa, set the wall light to 50%"
"Alexa, switch bedroom lights off"
"Alexa, increase the table light 10%"
"Alexa, set blinds to 40%”
"Alexa, move jalousie slats to 30%"
"Alexa, activate air conditioning”
"Alexa, deactivate socket 2"
"Alexa, turn on party”
